Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Initial release: Statistical Downscaling Climate Models v1.0

This release represents the cleaned and documented version of R-based 
statistical downscaling methods developed during doctoral and post-doctoral 
research (2006-2015) in computational hydrology.

Major components:
- 276 R analysis scripts organized into 8 modules
- Multi-GCM ensemble downscaling methods
- ARIMA time series forecasting
- Moran''s I-based stochastic weather generation
- Sample datasets and configuration files
- Comprehensive documentation (README, overview, cleanup plan)

Repository cleanup summary:
- Reduced from 136,750 to 1,655 files (98.8% reduction)
- Removed generated outputs, retained source code and inputs
- Reorganized into modular structure for reproducibility

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git tag -a v1.0 -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Version 1.0 - Initial Public Release

Statistical Downscaling of Climate Models for Regional Hydrology

This release marks the first public availability of methods developed 
during 2006-2015 doctoral and post-doctoral research.

Key Features:
- Multi-GCM ensemble downscaling (CGCM2, CSIRO2, ECHAM4, HadCM3, PCM)
- SRES scenario support (A1, A2, B1, B2)
- SST teleconnection integration (ENSO, IOD)
- Moran''s I spatial autocorrelation preservation
- 276 R scripts across 8 analysis modules
- Comprehensive documentation for reproducibility

Research Period: 2006-2015
Documentation: See README.md for complete methodology and usage
License: MIT with academic use notice
EOF
)")

Bash(gh release create v1.0 --title "Version 1.0 - Initial Public Release" --notes "$(cat <<''EOF''
# Statistical Downscaling of Climate Models for Regional Hydrology

This release marks the first public availability of methods developed during 2006-2015 doctoral and post-doctoral research.

## Key Features

- **Multi-GCM ensemble downscaling** supporting 5 models (CGCM2, CSIRO2, ECHAM4, HadCM3, PCM)
- **SRES scenario support** (A1, A2, B1, B2)
- **SST teleconnection integration** (ENSO, IOD)
- **Moran''s I spatial autocorrelation** preservation for stochastic weather generation
- **276 R scripts** across 8 analysis modules
- **Comprehensive documentation** for reproducibility

## Components

### Core Analysis Modules
- ML-regression-multiGCM: Multi-GCM machine learning regression
- multi-regression model: Multiple regression for climate variables
- Stochastic: Spatial weather generation using Moran''s I
- arima: ARIMA time series modeling
- data-processing: Regional data extraction
- filling-NA: Missing data imputation
- cross-correlation: GCM-observation correlation analysis
- basic time series analysis: Exploratory analysis

### Capabilities
- Calibration/verification periods: 1971-1985/1986-1999 or 1971-1999/2000-2006
- Predictions: 1971-2099
- Configuration-driven approach for flexible model combinations
- Supports GCMs only, High-resolution only, GCMs+High-res, with/without SSTs

## Research Period
2006-2015

## Documentation
See README.md for complete methodology, usage instructions, and project overview.

## License
MIT with academic use notice

---

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)")
